449 produits enregistr√©s
0
3 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
13.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 17 aout 2020
After finishing the game I must say that I am looking forward to some DLC or even a second part.


Relicta is a puzzle game in which physics-driven cubes play a very, very important role. It may remind you, especially at the beginning of games like Portal, but as the story progresses it becomes its own sub-genre.

The premise is easy: Opposites attract each other while equal poles repel each other. What starts out as a simple move of this cube from point A to B in a linear fashion ends up being a challenge for your brain. Move the cube A from point A to point B but in the middle of the way you have to press a button that opens doors, put another polarized cube to attract the one that is traveling and thus make it turn or even prepare a path of polarized plates that in its path open doors to a robot that overrides the polarization and that is your key to the next puzzle.

And although when we play this kind of games we want puzzles, puzzles and more puzzles we also find a minimally decent story. The game starts by introducing several characters but it doesn't go deep into any of them so that they end up being irrelevant.
Around 4 - 5 hours the plot of the game takes a turn and what seems to be a mature, adult and even somewhat dark character ends up being the door to ironic phrases and bad jokes that accompany you until the end of the game, unfortunately.

PROS
-------------------
- Very varied and even difficult puzzles, with many different mechanics and dynamics.
- Visually it has AAA quality.
- Optimized and highly polished (no bugs)
- The game is immersive, you can go for hours and hours without realizing it.
- The story animates the journey between the different puzzles and maps
- The developers have greatly improved the game, listening to the feedback of the players, since the first demo.


‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•
-------------------
- The story could be tremendously improved.
- There are some mechanics that are introduced in the middle of the game that are not explained beforehand and can be frustrating
 
Xhento Of The Abyss
0
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
44.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 8 juillet 2023
I love Solving Puzzle Games
Repel / Attract
The core of Relicta is pushing and connecting cubes.
Move them from area A to area B, attach to exit buttons and proceed to another chamber.
Simples?
It was at this moment that I knew... I needed a cube to get out -_- 
Une capture d'√©cran de Relicta
Par : Lord Of War

Embarrassing Writing
No story whatsoever. Lots of swearing though!
Who wrote these dialogues? Tarantino? 
Une capture d'√©cran de Relicta
Par : Lord Of War

Right, there's Moon research stations with giant domes, inside which main characters play with cubes.
What's the purpose of magnetic maps, origin of that purple mineral - who does even care.
Just solve room by room and listen to another bunch of f-words.

Spike Difficulty and Soft locks
Puzzles on their own are great. Have to consider multiple elements:
angled pole platforms, force fields (one for you, another for a cube), pole alternating fields, drones intercepting cubes, timed platforms and soft locks...
Incorrectly calculate trajectory - you cube flies accros a map. Hesitate a bit and a drone carries your cube away.
do cubes dream of electric jungles? 
Une capture d'√©cran de Relicta
Par : Lord Of War

Good brain teaser
Nice game to play solely for solving puzzles (I get serotonin for that!)
Horrible story with inadequate language for no reason. "F-you, f-them"... really?
 
Un d√©veloppeur ou une d√©veloppeuse a r√©pondu √† cette √©valuation
Lord Of War
664 produits enregistr√©s
0
6 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Non recommand√©
0.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 mai 2021
This game is .... OK I guess. It looked good from the screenshots and it does look good in-game but that's 90% of the best thing about this game: how it looks. For the rest it's basically a very poor man's Portal but with annoying voice actors, a mediocre story and worse puzzles.

Despite the game's good graphics, the game lacks a soul - the environment is far too clean and lacks detail to make it a believable world. In Portal you had the excuse that they were test tracks - here you have squeaky clean corridors & rooms with at most a cup of coffee here and there. OK, the game was made on a small budget but giving heart to your game to me is a very important element and it wouldn't take all that much effort to do. Just add some more personal notes, leave around personal effects, show the world has been lived in.

The game also uses the lamest excuse for you to do puzzles. Crew trapped and freezing in an arctic biome? "Well you have to do the puzzles to reach them". Yeaaah right. Because the only route anywhere is through a giant maze of puzzles using gloves only you are wearing. What nonsense.

I have to give props to the devs for trying but a game is more than a "by the numbers" thing and I feel that it doesn't offer enough outside its basic scope. You have a "story" which is not all that interesting and it's clear the game comes up with excuses for you to do pretty lame box puzzles. Portal had a far better mechanic than this and also had GlaDOS to keep things interesting. This game only offers some annoying people with heavy Indian accents blabbing in your ear all the time.

It's a 5/10 basically - at this point I'd rather they'd have cut all the story nonsense and just given you a bunch of puzzles.
 
Majestic 12
0

Nice graphics.
But story is poor and puzzles become boring.
The density of puzzles is too high, after 20 minutes of the game you start to get tired.
Big job were done, but in my opinion it was better to split this game on several small ones and rich the gameplay with cutscenes and plot.

it's 6/10

I gave up in the middle of the game and watched the rest walkthrough on youtube

P.S. I played Portal, The Stanley Parable, The Turing Test, Superliminal, The light matter, etc.
They all are cool because plot events and puzzles are balanced there. Unfortunately, this is not the case of this game.

Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Relicta - –ª–∞–±–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω–∞—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞. –¢—ã –Ω–µ –≤ –∏–≥—Ä—É –∏–≥—Ä–∞–µ—à—å, –∞ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—à—å –≤ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤, —ç—Ç–æ —Ä—É—à–∏—Ç –≤—Å—ë –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã, —Ç—è–∂–µ–ª–æ –≤ 2020 –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —à–µ–¥–µ–≤—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞–ª–æ —É–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã–º —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∑–∞–≥–∞–¥–æ–∫ –≤ –Ω–µ–∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ–º –º–∏—Ä–µ, —Å –±–µ–∑–ª–∏–∫–æ–π –≥–µ—Ä–æ–∏–Ω–µ–π –∏ –º—è—Ç—ã–º —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç–æ–º. –ò–≥—Ä–∞ —Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω–æ —Å—É–¥–æ–∫—É - –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞ –∏ –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ.

Relicta - –ª–∞–±–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω–∞—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞. –¢—ã –Ω–µ –≤ –∏–≥—Ä—É –∏–≥—Ä–∞–µ—à—å, –∞ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—à—å –≤ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤, —ç—Ç–æ —Ä—É—à–∏—Ç –≤—Å—ë –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã, —Ç—è–∂–µ–ª–æ –≤ 2020 –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —à–µ–¥–µ–≤—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞–ª–æ —É–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã–º...

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
61.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 16 novembre 2022
Hidden gem of puzzle games. I really enjoyed beating it. The difficulty was balanced just right for me - not boringly easy when you can read the solution as soon as you enter the puzzle room, but not tediously hard so you could get really stuck. A few puzzles can be cheesed or at least feel like you solved them in an unintentional way. But this was actually also satisfying, because it felt more like you outsmarted the game, instead of it being just broken. The story is ok and the characters are likable. Great game, it deserves more attention.
 
pav327

√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 aout 2021
With 2 free DLC's and tons of challenging puzzles it is in my opinion one of the best physics based puzzle game in the Portal/Cube genre. It is a bit repetitive but will keep you busy for a long time. Lots of thanks to the developers, muchas gracias

Recommand√©
12.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 19 avril 2021
A bit more fleshed out lore than Portal, and a bit more puzzle difficulty as well.

The game is decent, with a few minor hiccups here and there.
IE.
-Some puzzles requires pixel perfect placement
-Some puzzles does not have enough checkpoints or method / ways to undo a mistake.

Game time: About 7~10 hours of puzzle solving + 2 expansions.

Relicta is a generally decent first person puzzle platform game. Basically Portal, but with Magnets and Gravity.
 
Monarch

√âvaluation publi√©e le 17 f√©vrier 2021
You are a lunar scientist with some magic gloves that let you control gravity and magnetic polarity of magic cubes. You can ride the cubes and make interesting trick shots.
This game is the other side of the coin of Portal games. Nice puzzles and definitely deserves a playthrough.

It also works on Linux through Proton-GE

It's a 3D puzzle-platformer, one of the billion or so that follows in the wake of Portal's re-invention of the genre. As the genre goes though, some of these puzzles are nicely challenging, and the story is sufficiently interesting to motivate the solving of more puzzles.

Non recommand√©
18.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 mai 2021
-Some puzzles were extremely tedious if you messed up even in the slightest. The difficulty never really ramps up, the puzzles just get longer with more and more opportunities to mess something up
-Waiting for the drones to move around was painful.
-Why is there a speed running achievement? I don't see how you could think it's a good idea to have that achievement in the game
-Collisions are very bizarre, boxes getting stuck midair, yourself getting stuck midair, etc.

it's painful looking at my stats and being one off of 100% for this game, but there's no way I'm playing through the game again. The overall story is good, but the dialogue is jam packed with vulgar language that really ruined it for me.

I'd give this game a 5.5 I guess, I really liked the art style, but almost everything else is sub-par
 
Qiretha
716 produits enregistr√©s

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
39.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 7 janvier 2021
Very well made physics puzzle game with a lot of levels for the price - took around 40 hours to beat the whole game altogether. Each new puzzle presents it's own challenges and there are sometimes multiple ways to solve the same puzzle if you look closely enough. My only slight complaint is that the solutions to the puzzles feel cheap sometimes - like carrying a box sideways up a stair way that has purple box-blocking barriers, and then moving the mouse around until the box is in just the right position to be placed over the railing at the top. My advice - not all solutions are elegant. If you're stuck, try something that might seem stupid. This is probably only about 5-10% of the puzzles in the game.

The story was decent and kind of funny at times.
 
1.44 Megabytes

Non recommand√©
3.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 aout 2022
I like puzzles but this first-person story is boring. I'd rather skip any lore or cutscenes. Just take me to the puzzles. Okay, I didn't think this was going to be puzzle game at all. I just like the nice scenery but I think that's what the game is trying to do. It shows nice scenery but only allows you to enjoy if you beat the puzzles. This game also reminds me of another first-person puzzle game that is much better than this game. I wouldn't waste your money on this game unless you love puzzles. If you like first-person puzzle games, then get this game while its on sale.

Eine unsympatische Protagonistin, die viiiiiel zu oft unn√∂tig Vulg√§rbegriffe benutzt, ohne das es witzig oder sinnvoll ist. Eine lahme Erkl√§rung, warum man diese R√§tsel durchlaufen muss. Wird sp√§testens absurd, wenn es gegen Ende storytechnisch um Zeit geht.
Tr√§ger Plottwist, aber sympatischer "Freund".
Sch√∂ne Gegend, viele unsichtbare W√§nde, leere Einrichtungen.
Musste etwa 12 Level vor Ende v√∂llig entnervt einen Guide raussuchen, weil ich einen Trick nicht angewandt habe. Danach war die Luft irgendwie total raus und ich habe √∂fters in den Guide geschaut, als es selbst probiert. Ich wei√ü nicht, warum ich mich damit rumgequ√§lt habe. Verschwendete 17h meines Lebens.

Fazit: Nur f√ºr euch, wenn ihr Magneten liebt und/oder Spiele wie The Talos Prinziple zu einfach fandet.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 6 aout 2020
Un juegazo que te hace devanarte los sesos para resolver puzzles muy bien dise√±ados (¬°alerta! posible dolor cerebral en niveles avanzados) y en unos entornos ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• visuales impactantes. La mec√°nica b√°sica basada en f√≠sicas (magnetismo y gravedad) es simple y elegante pero da pie a un sinf√≠n de posibilidades. Adem√°s, la historia (que aun no se me ha revelado al completo) tiene un aura de misterio muy interesante y parece muy bien ambientada. Si eres un aficionado a la ciencia ficcion o los puzzles 3d, este es tu juego.

----
Great puzzle game that forces you to use your brain (it can hurt in later levels) sorounded with stunning visuals and landscapes. The basical mechanics based on physics (magnetism and gravity) are simple yet they offer countless posibilities. Furthermore, the lore (not yet fully uncovered) surround the puzzle solving with a well ambiented mystery aura. Must try for sci-fy and 3D puzzle lovers.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 juillet 2022
As others have noted the story and dialogue is grating but you can skip that. What is inexcusible, however, is that at one point I reached a puzzle and I had no idea what was expected of me because part of the puzzle was obscured from my vision. That's just bad design.
 
Mechahamster
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
12.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 juin 2021
Relicta will always be compared to games like Portal and The Talos Principle and out of those three it comes a strong third. The short version of this review is that yes, it's a good game, yes, you should give it a go if you like first person physics puzzlers, no it's not the best of its kind, and no it's not going to be your favourite.

PUZZLES
The puzzles themselves are clever though it's worth saying that they aren't super taxing. I had to get a fair bit of help with later levels in Portal and Talos Principle whereas with Relicta I didn't have to check all that often and usually I was stuck because I'd not seen something, rather than I didn't get the solution. That'll be a pro or ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• depending on how much of a challenge you want.

The magnetism and zero-gravity mechanics are solid and the puzzles well put together - levels are well designed so that most sections can be re-attempted without a length reset if you mess up - only in some parts of the Ice Queen update did I find some of the harder puzzles had really tedious resets if you missed something.

The weakest part is that by half way through the base game you've been taught all the different tricks. The rest of the game is is still solid but you've had all of your "oh that's cool" moments. Ice Queen adds some new mechanics which were good fun though.

The other downside is that some of the puzzle rooms got quite big and there's no mid-puzzle saving. The levels in the Aegir Gig update even warn you about this - those ones are pretty fun levels though.

The visuals are very good for a game of this nature, and they developers put extra work in for the two free expansions (Aegir Gig and Ice Queen) that they could easily have avoided, just reusing old assets.

The story is pretty average average, lacking the punch of Portal or the background intrigue of Talos Principle. I think the voice acting would have been helped if the script had less swearing in it - the bad language didn't add anything to the drama and the actors had to pour a lot of energy into the swearing which undermined their other efforts.
 
Garrick
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
45.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 21 mai 2021
Truly beautiful visuals. Especially impressive how good it looks without that RTX nonsense.
Challenging and demanding puzzles.
Sometimes indecent, vulgar language.
Annoying, childish dialogues and moody, noisy, not likable characters. Although I liked the idea of having some plot in a puzzle game but that was poorly written.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 juin 2021
As a copy of Portal and the Talos Principle, this falls short. the plot is not original and the gameplay is repetitive. Not to mention that the puzzles are boring and the graphics tend to be generic.

I don't recommend this one unless you received it for free. Otherwise save a little and buy the originals. Portal 1 and 2, The Talos Principle, among similar ones that are far better than this one.
 
fr3nchpress
0
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Non recommand√©
1.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 17 aout 2020
Produit rembours√©

For a game that boasts about how beautiful its environment is, it sure works its hardest to make sure you explore hardly any of it with invisible walls at every corner.
Extremely restrictive movement (no crouch or even jumping in certain sections) makes completing puzzles you already know the solution to a challenge, and not much in the way of innovating to solve a puzzle in an unintended way (because of all the invisible walls).
The attempt to put a story was ok but felt weak, am i really supposed to believe people use language that is outdated today over 100 years in the future?

I wanted to like this game but solving the puzzles wasn't as fun as it is in other 3d puzzle games like Talos Principle etc.
If you are desperate for a new 3d puzzle game buy it on sale but I would skip it at full price
 
mute
606 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 31 mai 2021
Portal done wrong, just replace portals with magnetism and gravity.
The story is dragged out and boring. Luckily it can be skipped.
There's a gazillion of pointless animations you have to wait out - PDA opening. Sliding cards into PDA. Touching to open the doors. Especially lovely when you have no idea where to go and so pointlessly wait to open doors you've already opened twice.
There's no reason why a game of this concept should require a significant amount of computing power to not be laggy. But for whatever reason the authors decided it'd be a good idea to spam the game with foliage and stuff.
The hands just flailing around in the air are kinda pointless too, especially since you can't see the rest of your body when you look down.
All controls are made for two handed play - one hand on the keyboard, one on the mouse. So why in the world did they put the PDA key to I and not TAB?

Essentially the only good element in this game is the puzzle element. With that the authors did a good job and since it's the main aim of the game, I am willing to recommend it for that. But the game as a whole is unimpressive, with rather mediocre design.
 
‚ôö Akko II

0
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Non recommand√©
0.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 4 octobre 2021
Any experienced gamer will romp through this, the puzzles themselves are not difficult. In the same way Portal was just a 3D rendering of a classic puzzle game, so is this, the logic behind the puzzles is basic with a graphical wrapper. While that sounds harsh, it's no different to tons of other puzzle games out there.

I mentioned Portal, this is nothing like Portal in the sense that the storyline is just cancer. If you can manage to listen to more than 3 lines of truly awful dialogue and take note of the overly sentimental nonsense storyline then well done you, I certainly never managed it.

Is it a bad game? No, it's certainly not a bad game. Has there been considerable time and effort put into the title? Sure, you can see that. Is it "good"... em... well that really depends on your experience, imo. If you are new to puzzle games then this is as good as any other to get (if you can deal with the dialogue) but anyone who has played similar puzzle games will find that once you scratch the surface of this game all you find is more surface.

It's a 'no' from me, if only because Steam doesn't have a 'meh' option.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 mai 2021
An hour in, already scratched my head a few times learning the mechanics/possibilities!

so, that's better than most other puzzle games i've tried recently!

graphics are a solid 9/10
audio is 8/10 (+1 for more interesting accent variety)
gameplay so far 8/10 (1st section past tutorial done)

oh also, Motion blur is under accessibility options
and the game runs really well so bump the supersampling to 120% (GTX1070, i7 6700)

Resoundingly "meh." I hope it picks up in pace, but noting the game mechanics, I doubt it will. The dialogue is soooo cringey, the characters are boring, but they nailed it with the visuals. Level design, ehhh... I mean sort'a. Like, why are there so many helmets just kind'a laying around everywhere? And random beakers of fluids just sitting out. I get it, "Girl-power science station, GO!," but like....c'mon.

It really isn't terrible, but it's DEFINITELY not worth your $20 in 2021. That's almost a full gallon of gasoline! >_>

0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 mai 2022
Love this game so far! Great graphics and storyline! Voice acting on point. The puzzles are interesting and not over the top. From what I gather, you are a scientist experimenting with technology discovered by a shady lab that dissapeared, technology decades past what it should be. Sounds like a good idea, right? Things seem to go well for two or three years. But at the start of the game you find out something went wrong! Now, you will find out what happened. The main character is an indian woman with a daughter which was a nice change from the usual caucasian male. I love her spunky attitude and rebellious nature. She also comes off as responsible and wanting to make the world a genuine better place, not a crazy scientist who will explore new tech even if it destroys all humankind. I never realized how often the crazy mad scientist sterotype came up before this. The nature graphics and lab were really cool to see too. My favorite are the little flying robots. Despite my short time playing the game so far, I am confident I will keep playing. Check it out!
 
Nightsky

0
Non recommand√©
3.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 28 octobre 2020
The puzzles are challenging, require forethought and are a decent mix of both active execution (ie requires timing / precision) and simple tactical / planning puzzles. What ruins it for me is the wholly selfish, unprofessional MC. She's presumably a scientist, working in a lunar station, cooperating with other teams in a delicate work environment and she's just a b!tch to EVERYONE all the time, like, why? It's suffering to play as her because you want to fail everything in the hopes that there's an easter egg good ending where the station explodes, and your collective genes are promptly removed from the pool, to the betterment of all.

Also it's pretty unoptimized and drops frames a lot on DX12 (only 1080p), but DX11 was okay.
Ultimately a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, desi-flavoured version of Talos Principle or any of the other Portal-likes, that brings little new to the table, and barely maintains status quo whilst managing to be horribly insufferable. Playing the game muted improved the experience, but not enough to recommend it.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 3 janvier
Frickelige Portal oder Cube-Alternative

Relicta ist ein R√§tsel-Spiel aus der Ego Perspektive. Man nutzt die Kr√§fte des Magnetismus um durch die Levelpassagen zu kommen.

+ sch√∂ne Grafik
+ stimmiger Soundtrack
+ verschiedene Areale mit verschiedenen Settings (Eis, Jungel, W√ºste, Fluss etc.)
+ simples Gameplay Konzept
+ Spielzeit ohne DLC 4-5h
- R√§tseldesign teils frustrierend (4x festgesteckt, die L√∂sungen waren "abstrakt")
- Zu dem og. Punkt kommt dazu, dass die Physik frustrierend ist: Die Kollisionsabfrage funktioniert eher m√§√üig, Folgeproblem als Beispiel: W√ºrfel kann man oft nicht ablegen. Das st√∂rt den Spielfluss sehr.
- am Leveldesgin st√∂ren die unsichtbaren W√§nde enorm (sowohl in der Breite, als auch in der H√∂he)
- die Story ist lahm, die Abschnitte in der Basis um zum Zug zu laufen sind langweilig

Solides Spiel, leider oft unn√∂tig frustrierend -> 6/10

√âvaluation publi√©e le 4 d√©cembre 2023
Wenn ein ehemaliger Mitarbeiter eines Scammer-Callcenters zu viel Rosamunde Pilcher und South Park gesehen hat, sowie dann damit beauftragt wird, Dialoge zu schreiben, w√§hrend sein 8-j√§hriger kleiner Bruder versucht, diese vermeintlich "logistischen" als auch "dramatischen" Aussagen umzuformulieren, d√ºrfte das Ergebnis so ziemlich genau diese Dialoge sein!

Gef√ºhlte 40% "‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•", 30% "You" sowie 20% sinnfreies Gejammer und Beschimpfungen, garniert mit 10% Storytelling. Die Sprecherstimmen sind so abgrundtief l√§cherlich, dass man es schon als peinliche Belustigung bezeichnen kann.

Pro:
Sch√∂ner Aufbau
Stimmige Farbgebung
Logische Elemente

Contra:
Physikalische Effekte sind teilweise etwas merkw√ºrdig
Es gibt gelegentlich kleine Objekt-Bugs oder das Festkleben der Spielfigur
Die Story ist sehr schwach und st√∂rt sogar in dieser Form etwas

Fazit:
Man muss bei diesem Spiel etwas knobeln, die Schwierigkeit liegt hier bei etwa 50%. Das Ausprobieren von verschiedenen Herangehensweisen bringt zumindest mir eine enorme Spielfreude. Die Steuerung und Geschicklichkeitsanforderungen liegen hier jedoch zumindest f√ºr mich √ºber dem Durchschnitt ‚Äì bis hin zur Nervigkeit.

W√ºrde ich dieses Spiel empfehlen? Wenn ja, f√ºr welchen Spieler-Typ?
Ich habe das Spiel f√ºr nur 1,99 ‚Ç¨ in der BF-Aktion gekauft, es ist aber definitiv mehr wert.

28.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 octobre 2023
TL;DR: Decent puzzler. Wait for a sale.

If you like first person puzzlers, there is a good chance you'll enjoy this somewhat.

The game feels little uneven. What I mean is some puzzles are great. Sometimes the puzzles are difficult and it takes me a while to figure out the solution and when I have the ‚Äúaha‚Äù moment, it feels great and then I can solve the puzzle. But then there are the puzzles where I immediately see the intended solution right away, but is tedious and annoying to execute, requiring way too many retries just to execute the solution that I already understand but can‚Äôt quite get the timing of. I hate those puzzles.

And then there are the puzzles that I have the aha moment and can see how it *should* work, but I can‚Äôt convince the floating cube to go to the precise direction that I needed to and it either gets stuck or falls into a place where I can‚Äôt reach it and I have to start the long puzzle over again from the beginning just to retry the part that doesn‚Äôt work consistently, and I just get frustrated. So then I look up the solution on YouTube to make sure that I am doing it right, and the person that provided ‚Äúa‚Äù solution was also frustrated, but found a more advanced yet *easier* way to bypass half the puzzle, so I never actually learned if I was doing it right. ü§£

The PDA button is so easy to accidentally press on a gamepad, and takes so long to go through the animation before you can dismiss it. Thankfully, you can remap (or remove) the button that triggers the PDA.

I didn't care for the music. What I mean is that music does a lot to create the atmosphere, and I felt like I didn't connect with the atmosphere, and when I thought more about it, I realized it was the music. It was too quiet, and is lacking something. It helped to turn up the music volume, and turn down all the other volumes.

One of my biggest gripes is the inability to save in the middle of a puzzle, and no chapter select to easily replay specific levels.

One thing I really appreciated was the inclusion of a "run" button, so I can move around faster.

Some of the puzzles seem to have parts that have no reliable solution, and are based on luck.

In a couple cases, I'm not even sure how I'm "supposed" to solve the puzzle, and when I found a solution, it feels like I broke the puzzle or solved it in an unintended way. I like that I was able to progress to the next level, but when I solve something because a box floats and bounces around randomly, and coincidentally *accidentally* ends up where I need it to go, that doesn‚Äôt feel right and it's not a satisfying solution.

I didn‚Äôt like the writing. The voice acting is OK, I mean, there were some parts I didn't like, but the acting was not terrible. It irritates me when one character supposedly interrupts another character, so they stop talking mid sentence, but there is a pause/silence before the next line is played. But that's not really the fault of the voice actors. The story was OK. I didn't find the story terribly compelling. It was merely there to string together the puzzles to provide a reason for doing them. I stopped caring about the characters and just wanted to get through all the puzzles. I really liked the last set of puzzles.

Overall, it was still an enjoyable game to play because I purchased it at a good sale price ($3), but does not compare to my favorite first person puzzlers: Portal, The Talos Principle, and The Entropy Centre.

I will never get the speed run achievement because it would be too frustrating for me to redo all the puzzles with a time limit.

I do wish there was a level select, or at least chapter select, or a way to replay specific puzzles, since there were some puzzles that I really liked, and some of the more frustrating ones could be considerably less frustrating if I could retry them‚Ä¶ easily.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 4 octobre 2023
It just bored me, is so long and empty. Why make it so big if there will be nothing to fill it with? Its almost a walking simulator.

I really like this kind of game, and even if I don't like one so much, I still try to finish it. This one, I just stopped playing it for a while, and right now, I decided to uninstall and forget it. I can't recommend it.

Recommand√©
53.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 octobre 2023
Relicta is a mixed bag for me. Belongs squarely to same genre of games as Portal 1&2 and The Talos Principle (TTP), it isn't nearly as good as those.

The good:
- looks very nice, especially the jungle levels; some levels are really laid out in three dimensions
- some "new" physics compared to the classics mentioned above: anti-gravity and magnetism
- a good amount of play time
- you probably never have to reset a puzzle because you're really stuck
- keept me playing while waiting for TTP 2

The bad:
- the puzzles in the second half of the game just keep getting longer/bigger, way too long really, without really feeling more interesting or even harder
- the constant verbal abuse in the first half of the game was really annoying to me
- the story isn't bad, but really thin and formulaic
- various usability issues: the game tries to make a number of actions easy (like grabbing or dropping a cube), but often fails to do so (gets your intent wrong and pulls you away), and this is mildly irritating
- the hall areas are a real waste of time, even though they look okay
- the areas LOOK open for exploration, and yet they are clearly not

Overall, I don't think it's worth the full price, and not worth playing to the end (except for the sets). I think I'll skip the two DLCs, even though they were included.

Recommended with caveats, only if you're a real fan of the genre, and in need of more 3D puzzles, whatever they are.
 
playful_tux
19 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
91.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 3 juin 2023
Some believe that puzzle games should be all about brain and not require dexterity or luck. I leave it up to you to decide for yourself. But in Relicta, you will need a little dexterity and a little luck. Sometimes you will struggle with one or the other and might be frustrated because 1) you know what needs to be done but you can't quite do it or 2) there is a subtly new way of interacting with the universe that you did not yet realize and the game did not do a good enough job of teaching you. I don't mean a new mechanism, but a known mechanism that you need to manage a little differently. You'll know what I mean when you encounter it.

So listen, this game is not perfect, but there is delight along the way, there is satisfaction, and there is a LOT of content. A lot. An outlier in that respect. The puzzles are not easy. The setting is visually interesting and not just an afterthought as is too often the case with puzzle games. I wasn't too into the story aspect but there is that for those who like it (and the rest can skip it). Also, you should know there is abundant swearing. Despite its flaws, I am fond of this game and it is without doubt excellent value for the money. I will look forward to this studio's other games.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 mai 2023
Interesting (and challenging) physical puzzle games. The dialogues of the background story are performed vividly. Very good stability (no crash at all after more than 70 hours). The surrounding scenery gives a nice atmosphere. One negative aspect: some puzzles (at the end of the story) are quite big, and there is no save operation offered by the game. But after all a great puzzle game.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 mai 2023
Fantastic game!

Main game: 25h
Free DLC1+2: 20h

Easily worth even the full price in 2023.
I've played a lot of first person puzzlers and Relicta is one of the most fun & (re)playable ones.

Pretty, detailed surroundings.
Smooth gameplay & performance; haven't encountered any bugs.

Challenging puzzles that take some planning to figure out, but they're never insanely hard.
Near the end of the game, puzzles can get really long and you have to reset the whole level when you make a mistake. A rewind button would be nice there.

Cringe story & voice acting, as is usual these days, but thank Almighty Polygon for a SKIP Dialog button!

√âvaluation publi√©e le 3 mai 2023
Relicta is a physics puzzler, in the vein of Portal and similar games. It does a good job providing interesting challenges, and it introduces new mechanics at a good pace. The story is a bit take-it-or-leave-it, but the physics puzzles are really what you're here for anyway.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 29 mars 2023
Im Gro√üen und Ganzem ein recht gutes Puzzle-Game. Die Puzzles sind oftmals um einiges anspruchsvoller im Vergleich zu Spielen wie Portal und dementsprechend auch, umso interessanter f√ºr Fans dieses Genre.
Trotz weniger Mechanics (die 3 Grund-F√§higkeiten (Farbe blau, Farbe rot, Block schweben lassen) und sp√§ter Roboter und Plattformen die die Bl√∂cke transportieren), kann das Spiel doch recht kompliziert, gerade eben die Bereiche die unendlich gro√ü.

Hinsichtlich dessen gibt es ein paar Kritikpunkte:
-> Der Gr√∂√üte; die Spieldauer. Das Spiel ist super wenn man regelm√§√üig mal 30-120 min. daran spielt, aber 5-6 Stunden (zum Beispiel im Stream) sind sehr anstrengend. Deswegen empfehle ich jeden die Spieldauer pro Session zu beschr√§nken. An sich ist die lange Spieldauer auch nicht so ein negativer Punkt, da man hierf√ºr viel Content f√ºr sein Geld kriegt.
-> Die gro√üen offenen Bereiche sind oftmals durch ihre Gr√∂√üe un√ºbersichtlich und entmutigend dadurch. Man verliert schnell den √úberblick √ºber s√§mtliche Puzzles und somit muss man gezielt sich einen Pfad vorher festlegen oder mit dem Block quer durch das Level schweben (ja, man kann das Spiel exploiten und ganze Bereiche skippen).
-> Story ist belanglos und zu langsam. Sie wird "pl√∂tzlich" erst gegen 60% des Spiels aufgegriffen und verl√§uft richtig linear von dort an. An sich gab es im nachhinein schon ein paar lustige bzw. auch interessant Dialoge (dadurch das sich eine Pr√§misse gebildet hat), aber im Endeffekt zu sp√§t und nur isolierten Instanzen.#

Viele Spieler werden die Story wahrscheinlich nie mitbekommen haben.
Schlussendlich w√ºrde ich das Spiel jedem empfehlen der das Genre mag und sich bei dem Schwachpunkten zu helfen wei√ü (was generell Schwachpunkte im dem Genre sind).
Einen Daumen hoch.

As a puzzle game about gravity, it pushed me away initially, but then pulled me in hard.

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

Non recommand√©
17.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 octobre 2022
some "solutions" are so obscure, they ruin the puzzles for me. the physics sometimes makes no sense at all (same setup, different outcomes) and the game gives you absolutely zero feedback when you need it the most. especially for a game like this, the rules need to be absolutely clear, otherwise the player spends his time making random guesses because it's unclear whether something is supposed to work or not. you need to be able to solve these things in your head. it shouldn't be necessary to repeat the same thing many times to see if it's possible in game. if you had the correct idea, the game needs to show you that. if your idea is wrong, it must *clearly* not work.
but in relicta, things often barely work (or don't), so the player is often lost in an ocean of maybes.
not a single time i looked up a solution did i think "oh, I was so stupid". it was always "wait, *that* was an option?". the game simply fails to present the rules and sometimes hides relevant puzzle elements or how they are supposed to be used. sometimes the rules change without any notification, like when you're suddenly required to micromanage a floating cube (until thast point you always only had to set things up correctly in advance)
 
hamsterofdeath
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

√âvaluation publi√©e le 30 avril 2022
Buena colecci√≥n de puzles que le sacan partido a conceptos tan sencillos como atraer, repeler y levitar; todos est√°n bien planteados para que se entienda que soluci√≥n se busca aunque pueden surgir picos de dificultad cuando se espera que pienses al margen de lo que se te ha ense√±ado hasta ahora. Tambi√©n tiene una historia que ayuda a hilar el avance ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• un universo interesante por conocer. La trama central tarda en arrancar pero una vez lo hace lo √∫nico que chirr√≠a es que s√≥lo se pueda viajar entre zonas importantes de la base completando desaf√≠os.

Los gr√°ficos se ven de forma espectacular incluso en un PC no demasiado potente. Han conseguido un muy buen grado de fotorrealismo y cuenta ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• arquitecturas y biomas variados para no aburrir.

Por si fuera poco, los desarrolladores han incluido dos campa√±as extra de forma gratuita ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• puzles de mayor complejidad que exprimen las mec√°nicas.

0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
4.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 26 avril 2022
As of now, I haven't finished Relicta, but I feel like I have a good grasp on what it is about. Hell, I think I've already seen pretty much everything the game has to offer.

Let's start with the positives: graphics are truly gorgeous - beautiful landscapes, detailed environments with vibrant colors and artistic lighting. Levels create a calming mood further enhanced by nice atmospheric music. It's a shame that you can't really explore the world you traverse. Futuristic technology present throughout the game has a distinctive look (the cube design is especially cool), although a bit generic. Nevertheless, it contrasts really well with naturalistic biomes you encounter. I don't care about the story, didn't watch a single cutscene, so I have no opinion on it. The overall premise of manipulating magnetic fields and gravity is also cool and pretty unique - I love the inclusion of cube-riding, very satisfying way of moving around. I would say puzzle design is solid and creative at times, when they force you to think outside of the box, but..

BUT

... Relicta becomes very repetitive very quickly. You use the same mechanics over and over again ad nauseam, puzzles feel too similar to each other, barely introducing any new mechanics whatsoever. From what I've seen on YouTube, final levels aren't very different from the ones in the beginning. As the game progresses, puzzles become needlessly large, even maze-like, but more often than not you know exactly what to do after like 20 sec of exploring, but still need to run around doing tedious chores for about 5 mins before you're able to progress. Wonky physics and janky hitboxes are your bread and butter. Not to mention, at times all I can see is a visual cluster‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• of colorful magnetic fields, cubes and laser fields. And don't get me started on the hub area, it's totally pointless and legit annoying after a couple of hours.

Overall, not a bad game, but don't expect anything amazing. It's just a mediocre experience. Another Portal wannabe.

 
VouZ_nel
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
18.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 22 avril 2022
This was a good puzzle game, very much like "Q.U.B.E." but with beautiful (and less oppressive) environments.

The puzzle aspects are almost all based on manipulation of gravity and magnetism. The physics (at least for me) worked well and were very intuitive (remember that magnetism can go through surfaces!), and only a few times I had to fudge around my solution to get it to work in ways which seemed unintended.... oh, probably my fault for trying strange solutions.

Besides, the graphics are absolutely gorgeous to look at, and I found the story and dialogue well written (mind you, characters use the F-words frequently, so, if that bothers you, you might want to stay away; and the main character has "plot blindness" for a while, but that is oh-so-common in all media).

Some flaws: the game severely limits your ability to go explore the environment, using many artificial walls; but that might be a good thing -- the "space station" environments, which do allow some exploration, are graphically pretty but very empty and lifeless (nearly non-interactable), which comes across as very boring. I would rather have limited but interesting exploration than lots of freedom to do boring stuff (looking at you, collectibles).

But all in all, an enjoyable puzzle game, not as creative as Portal or The Talos Principle (in part because there are very few different puzzle mechanics), but still a nice romp, with an interesting story. Score: 82/100.
 
Thexder0

ÊÉ≥‰∫ÜÂçäÂ§©ËøòÊòØÁªô‰∫ÜÂ∑ÆËØÑÔºåÁ±ª‰ºº‰º†ÈÄÅÈó®ÁöÑÁÆ±Â∫≠Ëß£ÂØÜÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂíå‰º†ÈÄÅÈó®ÊØîÊúâÂÖ∂ÂûãÂç¥Êó†ÂÖ∂Á•ûÔºåÂêéÊúüÈöæÂ∫¶‰∏çÂú®ÂÖ≥Âç°ËÆæËÆ°‰∏äÔºåÂú®‰∫éÁ¢éÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∞èÂÖ≥Â∞±ÊòØÂá†‰∏™Ëß£ÂØÜÊãº‰∏ÄËµ∑Ôºå‰∏Ä‰∏™Â±ãÂ≠êÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÊääÈáåÈù¢ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁÆ±Â≠êÊãøÂá∫Êù•ËÄåÂ∑≤ÔºåÂ∞±ÁÆóÂÅöÊàê‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂçïÁã¨ÁöÑÂÖ≥Âç°ÈÉΩÊ≤°Âï•ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÁî±‰∫éÊëÜÊîæÔºåÁ©∫Èó¥‰ΩçÁΩÆÁ≠âËÆ©‰Ω†‰∏çÂ•ΩÂèëÁé∞ÔºåËÄå‰∏îËøôÁßçÊÉÖÂÜµË∂äÂà∞ÂêéÈù¢Ë∂ä‰∏•ÈáçÔºåÈöæÂ∫¶ÈÉΩÂú®ÊâæÁ∫øÂ§¥ÔºåÊØèÂÖ≥ÈÉΩ‰∏çÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Êï¥‰ΩìÊâÄ‰ª•Ë∂äÂæÄÂêéÁé©Ë∂äÊäòÁ£®„ÄÇÊõ¥‰∏çÁî®ËØ¥ÈÇ£‰∏™‰∏≠Èó¥Áªô‰Ω†‰∏™‰∏≠ËΩ¨Á´ôËøûÊâÄÊúâÂú∞ÈìÅÁöÑÂú∞ÂõæËÆæËÆ°ÔºåËøòÊ≤°ÊúâÂºïÂØºÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåÂæàÂÆπÊòìËø∑Ë∑ØÂä†ÁªïË∑Ø

Osuka Sama
178 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
30.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 3 f√©vrier 2022
Relicta is a pretty good physics puzzle game. It wouldn't have the broader appeal of the Portal games but for fans of these type of games it may be worthwhile.

The puzzles are of pretty good quality. At it's heart it revolves around manipulating magnetism and gravity to move cubes around to the right switches. The puzzles are challenging but generally manageable. Some of the puzzles once you get further in to the game are quite convoluted and can be a bit overwhelming to take in once you first enter a puzzle area. But with looking around and a bit of trial and error it's usually possible to break the steps to complete it down. That said I did on occasion have to consult a video guide to figure some parts out. But it was usually a case where I was stuck on one specific part of a puzzle and could usually figure the rest once I'd seen how to do the part that was troubling me.

The areas the test tracks are set in look really nice too. The game is set on the Moon but most of the puzzles take place in biome domes so rather than doing the test tracks in sterile lab rooms you'll find yourself in an icy biome or a jungle one and I thought this variation in scenery helps especially as it's a fairly long game.

It's the parts in between the puzzles that are kind of dull. When moving from one biome to another you'll find yourself running around samey corridors to find the train in the next area. Even though there are collectable items and logs in these areas it just feels like padding. The story just isn't interesting enough to make those inbetween bits worthwhile.

In fact at times the story feels hilariously disconnected from the actual gameplay. The story is basically about an alien lifeform taking over the moonbase and it feels more appropriate for a shlocky 00's sci fi first person shooter rather than a physics puzzle game. It often doesn't really make sense why your character is just going through the motions and solving puzzles when all that is going on in the background. Also all the human characters are quite annoying.

But I dont want to be too harsh because even while I didn't like the story parts of the game, you can tell a lot of heart went into the game. The puzzles I enjoyed, even if the main campaign feels a bit long. If you are still itching for more puzzles there's also two short extra campaigns which are a free addition so thats a nice touch too. All in all it's not an amazing game but I liked it overall and would recommend if you fancy a some physics based puzzles.
 
Del Mingus
1,782 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
69.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 28 janvier 2022
SINTESI DEL GAMEPLAY

Relicta √® un FPP il cui game design si fonda sull'uso dell'attrazione gravitazionale degli oramai classici cubi da puzzle, quasi sempre presenti in molti titoli del genere. Potrete caratterizzare a piacimento i cubi donando loro due tra le forze gravitazionali disponibili (se diverse attraggono, se identiche respingono) e decidendo anche se debbano risentire o no della gravit√† del terreno. Potrete caricare magneticamente anche alcune postazioni fisse utili ad attirare o respingere i cubi.

Diversi campi di forza permettono diversi tipi di interazione: bloccano solo i cubi, o solo il nostro personaggio o entrambi. La meccanica dei puzzle ci chiede di sfruttare il peso dei cubi per interagire ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• degli interruttori che cambiano la funzionalit√† dei campi di forza, creando in pratica una logica "chiave/porta" per permetterci di uscire dai livelli. Potremo interagire anche ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• dei robot capaci di muoversi seguendo percorsi prestabiliti e capaci di annullare le funzionalit√† dei cubi come anche di trasportarli.

Esistono anche interruttori semplici e a tempo per modificare, similmente a quelli a pressione, la logica funzionale del livello. La curva della difficolt√† √® tra le pi√π lente mai viste nel genere: il numero di camere √® molto elevato ma per molte ore di gioco la vita sar√† molto facile e il difficile arriver√† veramente solo nelle ultime fasi di gioco. Il gioco per√≤ rimane ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• un livello di difficolt√† pi√π medio che alto perch√© i pattern di risoluzione possibili sono sempre un po' gi√† scritti nella posizione degli oggetti interagenti: ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• una logica trial and error potenzialmente si risolverebbe quasi tutto, soprattutto agli inizi.

ESTRO ARTISTICO

Se in The Talos Principle il level design alternava estetiche provenienti da diverse architetture archeologiche storiche, in Relicta si alterneranno invece diversi tipi di biomi terrestri. Sono le ambientazioni naturali a fare da sfondo alle meccaniche di gioco donando suggestioni naturali molto funzionali alla tranquillit√† necessaria per affrontare le varie prove.

La narrazione ci vede sostanzialmente soli come accade per la maggior parte di tutti i giochi FPP... soli ma sempre in compagnia di qualcosa di subdolo ovviamente. In questo senso la storia tocca anche alcuni punti di originalit√†. Non c'√® molta variet√† musicale ma le dolcissime e tristi note che accompagnano tutta l'esperienza si rendono complici dei sentimenti paradossali che si generano affrontando profonde e pericolose insidie all'interno di paesaggi naturali bellissimi.

PRO

Gioco molto longevo. Storia ben caratterizzata. Estetica del level design molto evocativa. Meccaniche dei puzzle appaganti.

CONTRO

Anche troppo lungo. La meccanica dei puzzle svela ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• troppa facilit√† i pattern di risoluzione degli stessi. Troppi livelli eccessivamente semplici (sarebbe stato meglio farne un numero minore ma pi√π difficili)
 
Caligine

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
17.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 24 janvier 2022
Puzzles are quite good, but there are a few levels that could have used a bit more play testing - you can skip some mechanics or brick the level and you'll be forced to restart the puzzle. Most of the time they are short enough so this is not an issue, but it was especially painful when it happened for me on one of the last puzzles that is quite large and I had to replay it again. It can be infuriating.

That being said, the game is ~17 hours long. Even if the puzzles are based around the same core mechanics, each new level presents a new variation that keeps you thinking. The last few levels can look complicated and even messy, but on further inspection they are just several puzzles stitched together that are solved one at a time. These can be daunting, but the difficulty is manageable.

Story is OK. Sound and voice is good. The only thing to note is that there are no footsteps sound when you're running around the ship.
 
mooncrosser

√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 septembre 2021
Played for 6 hours so far, probably 35, 40% of the way through. Some quite challenging puzzles, nothing too hard yet, a lot of new mechanics thrown at you with no hints however it does kind of make a tutorial out of each new mechanic in the sense that you will learn it yourself & then continue to use it. I've only been stumped on one level so far but because of the games' physics it allows you to experiment in a bunch of different ways to find the right solution. I'm sure I've completed some levels in non-intended ways which is actually fun.
Would Recommend, 8/10
(Received through a humble bundle subscription)

172 produits enregistr√©s

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Non recommand√©
9.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 septembre 2021
Solid graphics and performance, an although cliche story of an alien entity found on the moon but there's a mystery to it and it it is presented by a solid voice cast. The dialog could use fewer edgy f bombs though and a less angsty protagonist. There are also datapads littered around the game in random places, with a wealth of background information that is just a poor and pass√© design and really something that should have been weaved in to the overall narrative more fluidly.

The core of the game is ultimately the puzzle solving, but by the time I made it roughly half way through the game and hit the Glacier Test Track, I had had more than enough of them and was ready for the story to truly unfold at that point and not continue to have it served up piecemeal.

Given the perhaps physics nature of the puzzles, or due largely to their design, too many of their solutions ends being affected by randomness or unpredictable cube behavior, or dexterity/timing check, leading to a repetition that adds to the tedium of the puzzle designs.

The puzzles becomes more and more tedious as you progress through increasingly convoluted and confusing map designs, that just serves to drag out the game and ultimately overstay their welcome.

Ultimately solving the puzzles doesn't feel rewarding in the end, more so they offer a sense of relief from the tedium of not having to go them again, until the game serves up another more tedious puzzle. And the satisfaction in solving the puzzles is really why you play a puzzle solver game in the first place, right?
 
Aexrael
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 aout 2021
Relicta es un juego de puzzles al m√°s puro estilo Portal pero ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• su propia personalidad que lo diferencia del resto. El magnetismo es la base principal sobre lo que gira todo, aunque es mucho m√°s complejo de lo que pueda parecer.

El juego nos narr√° una historia de experimentos cient√≠ficos en la luna donde vamos descubriendo cierta trama de ciencia ficci√≥n. Est√° bien que hayan intentado meter historia a un juego de este tipo y se agradece que haya ciertas conversaciones o intenten darle sentido a lo que hacemos, pero no deja de ser una excusa para el grueso del juego que es completar puzzles cada vez m√°s complejos y desafiantes.

El juego se divide en varias zonas que a su vez incluyen cierta cantidad de puzzles en un √°rea establecida. Cuando completas el desaf√≠o de esa √°rea desbloqueando la puerta de salida avanzas a la siguiente √°rea y as√≠ hasta completar toda la zona. Despu√©s de acabar una zona regresas a tu estaci√≥n principal para buscar tu siguiente destino. Entre zona y zona puedes tener alguna conversaci√≥n de historia o buscar algunos coleccionables.

Un primer punto a destacar son las distintas ambientaciones y zonas dentro del juego. Las √°reas donde est√°n los puzzles se integran ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• el bioma de la zona donde te encuentras. As√≠ nos encontramos interiores o exteriores de zonas de jungla, desierto o nevadas ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• distintos niveles de altura y elementos y objetos a combinar para resolver los puzzles. Se agradece mucho esta variedad de ambientes. Se hace m√°s agradable a la vista y menos mon√≥tono que si todo se desarrolla en c√°maras de pruebas de interiores claustrof√≥bicos como otros juegos del mismo g√©nero.

A lo largo del juego se utiliza el recurso habitual de irte a√±adiendo poco a poco nuevos elementos o estructuras que interaccionan ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• los puzzles para hacer la resoluci√≥n m√°s compleja pero a la vez m√°s gratificante. Al principio tendr√°s s√≥lo cubos y magnetismo, pero luego se a√±adir√°n plataformas m√≥viles, robots que mueven cubos, etc

A veces cuando has acabado de completar un puzzle complejo y llegas al siguiente puzzle de √°rea puede llegar abrumar encontrarte decenas de estructuras, cubos, palancas, plataformas, donde a simple vista no le ves ning√∫n sentido pero que poco a poco al explorar iras desentra√±ando como ir complet√°ndolo.

Los puzzles son complejos, pero la dificultad esta ajustada. ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• paciencia y razonamiento se podr√°n ir completando. Algunas veces dan m√°s sensaci√≥n de dificultad de lo que en realidad son. En algunas ocasiones intentas buscar una soluci√≥n compleja a una situaci√≥n que es mucho m√°s simple, pero lo mejor es darte cuenta que los dise√±adores del puzzle probablemente pensaron que cometer√≠as ese error y no caer√≠as en la soluci√≥n m√°s obvia complic√°ndote la vida . Otras veces te ocurrir√° lo contrario, pensar√°s que es m√°s f√°cil de lo que es y est√°s 10 minutos dando vueltas.

El apartado visual cumple sin alardes. Los paisajes del juego, tanto de jungla, nevados o des√©rticos est√°n bien realizados y son agradables a la vista. Algo m√°s flojos y mon√≥tonos son los interiores de la nave principal que hacen de enlace ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• las distintas zonas del juego pero donde no hay puzzles y s√≥lo estar√°s de paso.

Sobre la m√∫sica y sonidos el juego los utiliza en la justa medida. Los sonidos te ayudan a saber que est√°s aplicando efectos de magnetismo a cubos y otros elementos o los pulsadores y temporizadores que vas utilizando para guiarte, no hace falta mucho m√°s. Agradezco que apenas haya m√∫sica, sobretodo en las √°reas puzzles, sustituy√©ndose por el sonido de ambiente de la zona. Mejor para pensar ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• calma y concentrarte.

Relicta adem√°s tiene una duraci√≥n considerable para este tipo de juegos. Sin usar ninguna gu√≠a y tom√°ndomelo ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• calma y buscando todos los coleccionables y objetos de historia me dur√≥ unas 21 horas. Adem√°s hay contenido adicional gratuito que estoy probando ahora donde estoy encontr√°ndome alguno de los puzzles m√°s complejos del juego y que tras completar algunas √°reas estimo dar√°n varias horas de juego adicionales.

No se si en principio estos contenidos adicionales se pens√≥ en lanzarlos como dlcs de pago y finalmente se han dejado gratuitos porque al jugarlos parecen contener suficiente contenido y calidad para pagar por ellos.

Me sorprende y entristece que a pesar de que el juego tiene rese√±as muy positivas en general, la cantidad de rese√±as total es muy peque√±a, lo que me hace pensar que el juego no se ha vendido tan bien como deber√≠a. Una pena porque es un juego largo, cuidado, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• puzzles muy bien pensados y variados, que en definitiva har√° disfrutar a los amantes de los puzzles y desaf√≠os, a los cuales no les deber√≠a faltar este juego en su colecci√≥n.
 
BlacKNiGhT
350 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
17.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 12 aout 2021
Relicta is one of the better first person puzzle games, but still a far cry from Portal 2.

The visuals are fine, the story is ok, and conversations are mostly nicely written, and sometimes have some great puns.

However, the puzzles quickly turn from fun into chore (which is evident by the fact that 70% of the players completed the first area, only 40% completed the second area, and then less than 20% completed the next one, with only 10% of the people finishing the game).

Even when you do everything correctly, sometimes a box fluctuates just a bit away, making you miss the button or a platform, and forcing you to redo part of the challenge (and that's not because of bad performance, I had stable 60 fps). Furthermore, the game has a lot of minor issues with collisions, which become more and more evident and infuriating as the puzzles become more complex and longer to finish.

Finally, some puzzles are divided into clear stages, but those stages don't have checkpoints between them. Since some puzzles could easily take you half an hour to figure out (withot using a solution, of course), you then have to redo part of those if you have to go away from the game. In my case the game crashed once in the middle of a puzzle, just after a spot that could've easily been a checkpoint, so I had to spend 5-10 minutes to redo the first part of the puzzle. And again, it took 5-10 minutes only because I already knew how to complete that part optimally.

So overall, while Relicta is certainly not a bad game, it has its flaws which make it far less enjoyable than it could be had the developers added more checkpoints and polished controls/physics more.
 
Snus
969 produits enregistr√©s

Non recommand√©
2.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 13 juin 2021
I like puzzle games, but this one falls short. I keep having to repeat the same solution multiple times, not because what I'm doing is wrong, but because the games physics is too unpredictable. The story, which is usually the hook for me, was very lack luster and a lot of the world is presented in text documents. The story is also very strange. You're trying to save people's lives, but there's cube puzzles standing between you and your friends freezing to death. You ask the game to turn off the puzzles so you can save the lives of the people who work for the company, but the game tells you if you do that it's going to snitch on you and you'll get in trouble... for trying to save lives and not complete 50 cube puzzles when time is critical. O...K...

Also, the lady who I think is your best friend, cusses you out every time you talk to her. She's a massive a*hole and the dialogue between them is not engaging or enjoying.
 
Arkan01d
1,797 produits enregistr√©s
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Non recommand√©
12.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 juin 2021
Story is bland and transparent. The language of the characters seems forced and jarring. The areas between the puzzles although pretty, are so similar I found myself getting lost.

Puzzles are forgettable and tedious. This might seem like nick picking, but I feel it's important. There is this one puzzle in portal, where there are a series of elevated platforms. You bounce up an down while making your way up. I always think of that puzzle when portal is brought up. It was fun, it was memorable, it's one of the many reasons I recommend that game. The puzzles in this are like a game of Simon, you start off with a few steps to complete the puzzle. The next puzzle is the same as the previous, except there is a new step at the end.

I wouldn't say it's a bad game, but I will not recommend it to anyone.
 
Bad R0b0t
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
23.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 7 juin 2021
I have a love-hate relationship with this game. On one side, I like how it really goes deep into the base mechanics of the puzzles by not adding almost any extra feature alongside the whole game, and just exploring how the different elements work together and how you can exploit some of the physics involved.

Buuuuut then the puzzles are longer and more tedious the further into the campaign you are, reaching a point where, when you enter a new puzzle and see such quantity of elements all packed into a tiny space, knowing that if you decide to take on the challege you have to do it in one go because there are no checkpoints mid-puzzle or saving features, that your brain just says "please don't".

But in the end I've liked the game and, with the free DLCs they released, this is one of the few puzzle games that has given me over 20 hours of handcrafted playtime, so I can't really not recommend it.
 
jorloru

√âvaluation publi√©e le 12 juin 2021
Positive: -nice graphics
-general mechanics are easy to understand
Negative: -The physics puzzles are all based on moving magnetic boxes around
-The game is reaaaaaaaally slowly paced
-Puzzles become longer and longer which is frustrating when a puzzle bugs out and you have to restart everything

I got this game from Humble Choice. If you are planning to buy this, buy on sale. It's definetly not worth 20 bucks.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 juin 2021
This game is enjoyable, but I don't find the puzzles as satisfying as a lot of similar FPS puzzle games. Often they seem to rely on quirks rather than logical deductions.

I also don't particularly care about the narrative, but for this type of game it's definitely not make or break. For me its hard to be as engrossing as Portal 2 or even Lightmatter.

Definitely worth the sale price though!

Edit: Honestly the puzzles completely lost my interest like 1/3 or 1/2 through and I'm not even going to finish the game.

0.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 31 mai 2021
got to give it a thumbs down. especially after trying my damnest to use the keyboard/mouse and even controller after reading the constant reviews. it shows some promise, but the lack of consistent physics with the boxes i can only imagine the buggy mess when given even more to interact with and control/manipulate.. and im not looking forward to that cluster f**k of a mess and would rather give myself a hard pass and some tylenol for the effort i put in so far.

not worth the effort. by any means. boring interactive enviroments. seemed more like a physics puzzle test lab for throwing some ideas in with a lamented story thrown in afterwards for half a**ed good measure too. so theres 2 against it. and the third, every single area: devoid of life, other then the puzzle areas, which are aswell, if you dont count the blocks. lol. and the folks doing the voice overs.. half the time i would read subtitles and they were supposed to talk.. and nothing came out, then the game would skip forward in conversation and i would have missed a ton of "content and story" meh.

i really wanted to like this game, but for real a game like this needs to invite you in, and have a bit more substance.. not run folks away with the at best child like interpretation of physics, and adapt the concept to 3 buttons and make the game fight with you at every turn to utilize the concept and button presets.

Non recommand√©
2.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 30 mai 2021
The game has story and puzzles, sadly they are completely separated and mostly unrelated.

1. The story plays a "graphic novel", and "walkie talkie" discussions.
2. Then you move around to empty maps that are pretty much copy and paste of the same asset.
3. Eventually you get to the puzzle level.
Rinse and repeat.

Pos

  • There were some effort into adding story to the game
  • Voice acting starts weird but then it flows
  • Some puzzles were well thought.

‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•

  • Story and puzzles are two different entities.
  • Vast empty maps that you just walk around and see repetitive assets.
  • Glitches in the puzzles clipping the box into some walls.
  • It will take you almost 30 minutes/1 hour of graphic novel, empty maps (if you like to explore), until you get to the non tutorial puzzles.
 
Nils
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
40.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 22 mai 2021
I had this sitting in my library for a while, started it on whim, and boy am I glad I did.

If you liked The Talos Principle, and to a certain degree the Portal series, then you're gonna love this first person puzzler.

The presentation, as in, graphics and voicework are all top-notch, but the writing and story is pretty C-grade terrible (it gets better in the two free addons that comes with the game), but all that doesn't matter at all, because the quality and challenge of the puzzles were more than enough to keep me solidly hooked and playing nothing but Relicta until I completed all three missions, and got all achievements (except the speedrun one)

In short, if you like 3D first-person puzzle solving, then this one is a guaranteed hit!
 
GB.FlyveHest

√âvaluation publi√©e le 29 mai 2021
Logicka hra, kde k reseni urovni pouzivate magnety.
Na obou tlacitkach mysi je kladny a zaporny pol. Na kolecku je pote navic gravitace.
Mezi kazdou testovaci urovni je pribehova cast, kde se daji sbirat predmety do inventare.
Obtiznost se v pribehu prijemne lehce zveda, nejde to ale vubec do extremu.
Hra je dost propracovana at uz logikou i grafikou.
Milovnici logickych her nemuzou urcite nemuzou minout :)
 
MichalosxCZ
1,140 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
28.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 22 mai 2021
I thought this was a moderately good first person puzzle game. It may be worth playing if you like the genre and have already played Portal 1&2 and the Talos Principle (if not, go play those first). It has some strong aspects and some weak aspects, which probably reflects a relatively smaller team or lower budget.

Strong aspects:
The puzzles. The game's core mechanics of magnetism and gravity manipulation work pretty well and I never found the game either getting too unintuitive. The maps are pretty well designed. It's completely linear, but I never really got stuck, but also didn't feel like it was unchallenging.
The graphics. It's a little bit generic looking, but it's pretty.
The challenge and length. The game was hard enough to be worthwhile but not so hard it was obnoxious (which can easily happen with puzzle games) and it didn't outstay its welcome.

Weaker aspects:
The writing. Oh, god, the writing. The plot and setting is ok, I guess, not amazing or anything. But the DIALOGUE, dear lord. Every single character talks like a 20 year old techbro. And they swear constantly, even in internal communications and memos, which feels extremely out of character for a bunch of scientists in a corporate environment (maybe in their personal lives, sure, but not in workplaces communications!) Maybe it just got mangled when they were translating it to English?
The voice acting. It's mostly just tolerable, but there is one character for which it is kind of laughable. You'll know it when you get to it.
The collectibles and hub area. They're pretty perfunctory and just there to be there. Doesn't hurt anything but doesn't add much.

So basically, play it for the puzzles and gameplay, not so much the plot.
 
Mitrovarr
801 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Non recommand√©
17.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 mai 2021
Slightly uninspired puzzle platformer which feels a bit like a cross between Portal and The Witness.

Pros:
-Pretty long and many puzzles - You'll get quite a lot of game for your money. I think 12 hours of puzzles is quite possible even if you're a regular on this kind of games.
-Looks beautiful - The open colorful levels are quite a relief compared to some other puzzle-platformers.

Neutral:
-Puzzles in the first half, didn't feel inspiring or challenging. They IMHO get better later on, but "later" means 6-7 hours, so you might need some perseverance to get to the better parts. And even then there's some levels that are just long, not good or challenging.

‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•:
-Invisible Walls: looks beautiful, but thanks to a lot of invisible walls it often feels even more restricted than other some other puzzle-platformers.
-Story. Not many characters and no story development for the first 2-3 hours and once something happens? The protagonist pretends nothing happened for the next 2-3 hours. And even after this, it felt like someone had a pretty cool idea for a story, but decided not to inject a sense of urgency or suspense in an otherwise relaxed puzzle game. So they toned it down.

Undecided whether to give it a thumbs up or down. It's very medicore, but as I have to give either up or down...
 
ragnarok

Recommand√©
8.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 mai 2021
I'm decently far in now and I just need to say Relicta is extremely underrated. Seriously, there's less than 100 positive reviews despite effectively being on par with other 3D puzzlers such as Talos‚Äîit does a couple things better, like the puzzles are crafted more fairly with the environment properly hinting towards intended actions, and the difficulty curve is close to perfect, forcing you to learn the right things at the right time or place. It's really lacking music (play your own maybe). The story is very questionable, with shoddy English, incoherent gibberish and awkwardly forced F-bombs, but pretentious gibberish is honestly par for the course with its competition. A few more mechanics get introduced farther into the game.
The graphics are beautiful, it runs well, puzzles are consistent and there's plenty of content.
Early game has a few "hidden" cubes you should look out for that may confuse you.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 mai 2021
I'm enjoying it so far. I don't mind the walking sim story stuff, though it does seem a bit disconnected from the puzzle stuff. The puzzles are good. It's kinda a bit too obvious to make comparisons to Portal, Turing Test, Talos Principle and Lightmatter; Relicta can stand proudly alongside them as a very worthwhile addition to the genre.

There are a lot of criticism here saying it's just ripping off Portal and them complaining that it's not Portal. It's a bit like saying that a pizza is just a flat open sandwich and them complaining that it's not a good sandwhich.

Recommand√©
37.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 mai 2021
If you like puzzle games, I'd say this one is a must. First-person puzzle game which is clearly inspired by games such as Portal and The Talos Principle. It's not a good as those, but still worth your time no doubt. The puzzles are cleverly designed and work pretty well despite being mostly physics based, which will sometimes lead to an undesired outcome even if you did the right steps, but this happened very rarely to me. The story is interesting, even if the ending is a bit weak.

Game also includes 2 extra chapters, which could perfectly be sold as DLC, but they are included in the game, points for the devs for that.

Conclusion: if you're into puzzle games, stop reading reviews already and go play it !
 
Star Ocean
1,381 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
21.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 25 avril 2021
Relicta is a 3D physics based puzzle game with puzzles revolving around magnetism. You can switch the color objects from Red to Blue so that they attract/repel each other. The game is fairly good overall. The voice acting, plot, assets, physics, and game design are fairly high quality.

The game follows a linear difficulty curve, but I think it would have been better to have a few difficult puzzles mixed in early on as long as they were optional. The odd thing about this game is that the first half feels like a different game than the second. Not only does the plot completely change, but the puzzles required more out of the box thinking. I liked the changes to the puzzles, but I'm not so sure about the story.

The game also forces you to take breaks every 5 puzzles by making you walk around a facility to find the next zone. This is where you obtain collectibles and notes. I was fine with this at first but eventually felt like a pointless task since every transition felt the same.

 
Double Dark
0

It's an okay puzzle game. Played the main story and now waiting for bonus content patch. Will not try speedrunning it.

While playing, I did not feel excitement but tediom when going to the next puzzle set in each level. Puzzles get longer and a bit more convoluted, sometimes with obscure steps I could not figure out myself. There are a few puzzles requiring very accurate placement or timing of actions.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 30 aout 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

If you‚Äôre looking for the next Portal game then this ain‚Äôt it, but Relicta might just scratch that itch for a clever physics-based puzzle adventure. Best of all, Relicta makes you feel smart‚Ä¶if not immediately, eventually. I enjoyed exploring the concepts of magnetism and gravity and the clever use of switch pads and teleporters to defeat some truly mind-melting puzzles, often in ways I‚Äôm sure the designers weren‚Äôt expecting. If you‚Äôre even considering this game you likely have some experience with the genre and know what to expect, and those expectation will be fully realized and more when you explore the intriguing world of Relicta.
